title: Has anyone used Basecamp?
content:
Hello Everyone,

I am looking for an online project management solution for web design/project management that can handle multiple users on a team.

I've heard about Basecamp, and I was wondering if anyone in design/web development has used this application before.

Are there any other project management solutions that have group login such as Basecamp out there that would better solve my problem?

Basecamp: [http://www.basecamphq.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804041955/http:/www.basecamphq.com/ "http://www.basecamphq.com/")

Thank you for any suggestions you might have,

Adam Dolch
author: lazyeye88

comments.content:
I'm on a Basecamp group right now. I think it's excellent, but all I'm doing with it is uploading some files and checking images others post, but I seems like a pretty complete project management package. From what I've seen of it, I'd recommend it.

I also use Google groups, which has everything I would normally need to collaborate with others on line.

-=®=-

I've used it extensively for international clients, remote designers, and as a course convenor.

I've found it to be great for pulling together groups because it is very easy to use and orientation/learning happens through actual use, which helps speed up the start up stage.

Every group I've shared it with ends up using it in their own way. I usually make some suggestions at the start and then it beds in as the project rolls on.

I used basecamp for a couple of years, but now I've switched to a self-hosted option.

--\> The one I use is **Collabtive** , which is open source: [http://collabtive.o-dyn.de/?lang=en](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804041955/http:/collabtive.o-dyn.de/?lang=en)

--\> Previously I tried **ProjectPier** , which is also open source and quite good, but doesn't seem to be under active development: [http://projectpier.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804041955/http:/projectpier.org/)

--\>And a third one, commercial, but probably the most complete of the three so far, is **activeCollab** : [http://www.activecollab.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804041955/http:/www.activecollab.com/)
